intro: Chaerophyllum hirsutum var. roseum, commonly known as the rose-hair chaerophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
